data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person cannot always return to the starting point. Taking 10 steps in one direction will allow you to always be facing forward. A person taking 9 steps left cannot always find a starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes four steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps to go back to the starting point. Take 6 steps, and turn around and take 6 steps. Take 10 steps to complete the reversing of the direction. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn left, you just take 1 step i.e., 7 steps and take 1 step. If you are doing these sequences to return to the starting point, it is a no brainer. So, the answer is no.

The original instructions point you in the location you started from. For example: Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Turn left and turn right. The next step is to turn around and turn around. Then turn right and turn left. The answer is No.

Turn right and take the opposite steps. Take 3 steps and take the opposite steps. To get to a starting point, you should turn right and take steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

To return to the starting point you need 2 steps. The starting point is 6 steps from the end point. So, the answer is No.

A person can only face right and not left. One can only go left or right. We can only take 6 steps forward or 4 steps forward. So, the answer is no.

After taking 9 steps you turn around and take 2 steps. After taking 7 steps you take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always start in the forward direction, you wonâ t look back. If you change to the backwards direction of travel, you will look back or to the right. If you are looking to the first point, you will take two forward steps. If you are looking to the second point, you will take one step backward; you will then take three steps forward. Thus, the answer is No.

You can only take 5 steps left in order to return to the starting point. There are 6 steps backward in the first instruction. So, the answer is no.

If you're facing forward, you always want to be facing left. Taking 10 steps left gives you an 8-step walk backwards. 3 steps left is the same as leaving 3 steps and taking 1 step left. 3 steps right is the same as taking 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To always face forward, the original sequence has to be true. To take 3 steps forward, you start it from the same place as the previous instructions. The original instructions for a series of 5 steps would be to take 5 steps right, 4 steps left, 3 steps forward and 1 step right. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, if you are facing left you have 3 steps up. If you always face right, if you are facing up you have 3 steps down. If you always face up you have 6 steps left but you still cannot make it back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

At least 5 steps backward are repressed if you take 7 steps left. If you take 2 steps right you are in the third position, i.e. you are in step 1. If you take 7 steps forward you are in step 2. If you always face forward, only to return to begin with, you would not take the forward and return steps. If you face downward, only to make it to your starting point, you would. Typically, that is not an option for an inverted triangle. Typically, only angles. Therefore, the answer is Yes.
